elements.title: USS Missouri
elements.contents: ... that the only casualty of USS Missouri's destruction (pictured) was a pet bear?

elements.title: Lourdes Ambriz
elements.contents: ... that Lourdes Ambriz, singing voice of Belle in the Spanish version of Beauty and the Beast, became the artistic director of the Mexican national opera?

elements.title: used the Holocaust
elements.contents: ... that numerous historians and academics have argued that Israel has used the Holocaust to justify its treatment of Palestinians?

elements.title: Riho Furui
elements.contents: ... that Riho Furui wrote her debut song after struggling with life in Canada?

elements.title: sumo fighting stables
elements.contents: ... that professional sumo fighting stables are often housed in Shinto shrines when they travel outside of Tokyo?

elements.title: Mary Fortune
elements.contents: ... that the son of Mary Fortune – one of the earliest female writers of detective fiction – was a career criminal?

elements.title: Diane Orr
elements.contents: ... that Diane Orr and C. Larry Roberts were once said to "epitomize the regional, independent filmmaker"?

elements.title: a fictional U.S. congressman
elements.contents: ... that in 2010 journalist Jonathan Capehart fell for a satirical tweet made by a fictional U.S. congressman, then wrote a lengthy response in The Washington Post?

elements.title: Braxe + Falcon
elements.contents: ... that the musical duo Braxe + Falcon formed a supergroup with the band Phoenix to make music about UFOs?
